chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Noble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit for 45 days were granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation.  Follow through with any treatment and counseling recommended by Agent.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence FORTHWITH.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.a

Defendant Robert W Noble in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Andrea M Will and Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kay makes statements.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 45 days if revoked )
2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation.  
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Condition Time: 6 months Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith. 
FINE: $1744.00 Bail to be applied from this case and case #15CF1143
DNA Surcharge: $250.00  Bail to be applied from this case and case #15CF1143
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  Bail to be applied from this case and case #15CF1143
DL REVOCATION:  25 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 25 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant Robert W Noble in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the competency.  Defendant doesn't contest the doctors opinion.  Court finds the defendant competent to proceed.  Attorney Kay moves to address a bail motion.  State doesn't object to hearing the bail motion without a written motion.  Attorney Kay makes statements.  Attorney Kay address case # 15CF1143 that this defendant also has a pending hearing on 9/28/2015 @ 1:15 pm.  Court does not have case # 15CF1143 on the calendar today.  The State is not prepared to argue a bail motion in case # 15CF1143 since they do not have this file, or been given notice.  Court orders Attorney Kay to provide a written bail motion on both of these cases at this time.  There is no motion to forfeit bail at this time either.  Court sets this case along with the other hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Robert W Noble in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.   Not guilty plea entered by mental disease.   Attorney Kay requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.    The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail received from Attorney Kay.
Arraignment on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
